text:
I am probably going to publish my:
“What has changed since Julia 1.0” blog post tomorrow or Monday.
If anyone wants to tell me i got history wrong, or that I missed some awesome feature the PR is at <https://github.com/oxinabox/oxinabox.github.io/pull/17>

I have been working on this on and off since Nov 1st.
So many new features.

text: In temporary environments: Julia exists ->julia exits

text: I learned loads - great post. Perhaps <@US64J0NPQ> and I could try a double stream to go over the release candidate :smile:

text: <@U6A936746> I made tons of comments with lots of :heart: because I enjoyed it and it needed a bit of polishing

text:
<@U6QGE7S86> and <@U7JQGPGCQ> yous broke github, with too many helpful comments.

~<@UDB26738Q>~  <@U6NFPDBV1> also broke github on an earlier version

elements.text: and
yous broke github, with too many helpful comments.
also broke github on an earlier version

text: Sorry was that too much? I tried integrating everything in the hope that that would make it easier on you rather than harder... But then I've never been on the receiving end of a 70-suggestion review :joy:

elements.text: Sorry was that too much? I tried integrating everything in the hope that that would make it easier on you rather than harder... But then I've never been on the receiving end of a 70-suggestion review

text:
No, its great.
GitHub flakes out after about 100.
and you can’t access the file view.
When apparently between you and Miguel was hit.
But it is only just over and once i resolved a few in the comment section it started working.

When ~Mose~ Chris broke it, with something like 150-200 comments I had to resolve ?50 of them in Atom before github started working again  (Atom doesn’t let you apply suggestions but unlike github itself doesn’t crash)

text:
I wish during my PhD feedback on papers from my supervisors was this easy to apply.
Rather than getting a mix of hand-annotated photocopies,  pdfs with comments, and pdfs with hand written comments.

elements.text:
I wish during my PhD feedback on papers from my supervisors was this easy to apply.
Rather than getting a mix of hand-annotated photocopies,  pdfs with comments, and pdfs with hand written comments.

text: Haha agreed, I kept the marked up printed copy of my thesis that my examiner brought to the viva, as that had his corrections in :joy:

text: It was <@U6NFPDBV1> the other time, not me :stuck_out_tongue:

elements.text: It was
the other time, not me

text: Oh and also thanks for writing this - Having used Julia since 0.3, and mostly living on nightly or at least beta most of the time you completely miss the great strides that have been made

text: Ah my bad. I am heaping the blame/praise on the wrong people
